page.title: 03 SARK TRADITIONS
page.content: Sark has many traditions; one of them is the Sark costume.These are a black bonnet,a long dress and a purple shawl.Now the costume is only worn at special request.The red costumes of the Sark Militia is also worn on special occasions. On"La Fete de Saint Jean",Midsummers Day,horses were garlanded and young people rode them two-up;every house was open to them and tables were laden with plum cake,buns, locally brewed cider and crabs.The youngsters went to the common above Les Laches and sang and danced.There are also traditional songs and dances;"Dance de Chapieux" with hats,"La Frigande",and "Danse de la Brouaise" with a broomstick.Sark songs were usually variations of songs from other islands.
